titleStmt.title: An electronic transcription of Genizah Fragment Cambridge University TS F6.3
titleStmt.sponsor: Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies
Lieberman Institute; Primary Witnesses to Tannaitic Literature

publicationStmt.pubPlace: The Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities

availability.p: This work is copyright Hayim Lapin and the Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies and licensed under a .

note.p: Fragment in the Cambridge University Libraries, Taylor-Schechter Collection. Covers Bava Qamma 2:1 - 3:5; 10:9 - 10; Bava Metsi'a 1:1 - 2:5
Transcription from online images of the manuscript, available at http://jnul.huji.ac.il/dl/talmud/mishna/selmimnu.asp and at https://fgp.genizah.org. FGP nos. C166192-C166195
Supplied text based on Kaufmann ms, Library of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences, Kaufmann A50, except when preserved remains make such restoration unlikely.

handNote.note: Pointing is in a different ink than the main manuscript. Possibly a second hand.

revisionDesc.change: Shifted transcription to BM Ch 2, and revised tagging.
Updated tagging and header to reflect new schema

ab.label: ג׳
ד׳
ab.w: ש Lacuna seems to be too long. Perhaps מה שהיא נהנית?נהנית

ab.label: ז׳
ח׳
ab.note: Traces fit שלם (with נזק omitted) better than נזק. This would leave too much space for the continuation.
ab.label: ט׳
א׳
י׳ב׳
ab.w: אין אף To bottom right of deleted word there is a small circle marking the insertion. Again at B. Mets. 1:8; 2:1; 2:2
מחציה Small circle above line indicating insertion point.ויחלוקו

ab.label: ה׳
ab.w: Supplied text seems short for the length of the lacuna. הם

ab.label: ו׳
ab.w: נכסיןSupplied text follows presumptive orthography of this scribe: masc plu ending in -ן.
Supplied text follows Kaufmann MS., but the text of Kaufmann is probably too long for this lacuna.ן

w.note: Supplied text from Kaufmann seems a bit too long for the gap.

ab.w: שלשטרות Small circle marks insertion point.
מקום ממדינתן Small circle marking insertion point.
ab.label: ב׳
ג׳
ab.w: האומן Small circle marking insertion point.
